sentences.en: Far from being the drunken reprobate of popular legend, they found him punctual and hard-working.
sentences.cn: 远非流传的那样他是一个烂醉的恶棍，他们发现他既守时又勤奋。

sentences.en: He has always been a bit of a reprobate.
He ventured to reprobate that common system.
sentences.cn: 他很大胆地摈弃了一般常用的那种方式.

sentences.en: Surely His pleading with the lost, His offers of mercy to the reprobate, and the call of the gospel to all who hear are all sincere expressions of the heart of a loving God.
sentences.cn: 他对迷失方向的的人的恳求，他对堕落的人的同情，他对所有听到他声音的人施与福音，这一切真挚的表达都源于他充满爱的心。

sentences.en: The reprobate and Satan will suffer eternal punishment in hell.
sentences.cn: 被弃绝的人和撒但会在地狱受到永恒的刑罚.

sentences.en: They profess that they know God; but in works they deny him, being abominable, and disobedient, and unto every good work reprobate.
sentences.cn: 他们说是认识神行事却和他相背。 本是可憎恶的，是悖逆的，在各样善事上是可废弃的。

sentences.en: You cannot approbate and reprobate the same instrument.
sentences.cn: 你不能既批准而又摈弃同一文件.
你这个作恶多端的无赖!

trans.tran_en: someone who behaves in an immoral way – often used humorously
